page.title: 02THE M4
page.content: THE M4. Opened in I968 this is part of the main road route between London and South Wales.In this area it is less than 10 miles from the interchange with the M5.Motorways were planned to take the straightest and most level routes, but here there is a steep gradient up the scarp slope , to meet the A46 at the top at Tormarton. Beside this intersection is the Avon County Council Highways HQ where the County Surveyor is based. He looks after over 800 miles of road in Avon,making sure that they are in good condition,that the signs are up-to-date and dealing with gritting problems in Winter. In 1985 the County Council has been concentrating on resurfacing.
